subLabels.text: Types of hair treatment – shampooing, conditioning, steaming etc. stages of hair treatment
descriptions: Candidates should be able to correctly outline various safety measures to be taken.

subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Scalp disorders
descriptions: Cleanliness of the body and oral hygiene. Characteristics of grooming ( posture, exercise relaxation and balanced diet.)
Physical agents: moist heat, boiling water , steaming, dry heat, ultra violet rays. Chemical agents: antiseptics and disinfectants.
subLabels.Subject: Subject
subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Hair loss—causes, prevention and treatment
descriptions: Candidates should be able to describe how the various tools, equipment and materials are used. Manicure and pedicure tools, barbing clippers, facial implements e.t.c.
subLabels.Subject: Subject
subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Definition of hair
descriptions: Normal, dry, oily hair etc. should be studied. Combing, washing, brushing, cutting, trimming etc.
subLabels.Subject: Subject
subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Definition of hair colouring/tinting. types of hair colouring
descriptions: Appropriate treatment for dry hair, normal hair, oily hair and hair with dandruff should be studied. Shampooing, conditioning, steaming, trimming, drying and styling should be studied.
subLabels.Subject: Subject
subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Definition of hair relaxer types of hair relaxer—cold waves, texturizers etc. tools and materials for hair relaxing. procedure for chemical hair relaxing. safety precautions in applying chemical hair relaxers
descriptions: practical activities on scalp treatment.
Temporary, semi-permanent and permanent hair colouring should be studied. Candidates are expected to have carried out practical activities on hair colouring/tinting.
subLabels.Subject: Subject
subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Difference between hair pieces and wigs. types of hair pieces and wigs. reasons for wearing wigs. caring for wigs and hair pieces. tips for buying hair pieces and wigs
descriptions: Candidates are expected to carry out practical activities on hair relaxing.
subLabels.Subject: Subject
subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Hair weaving—reasons for
descriptions: Candidates are expected to have carried out practical activities on weaving.

subLabels.text: Hair weaving—reasons for weaving,  tools and materials. types of hair pieces for weaving. brand names of hair pieces
descriptions: Bumps, lice, hair shaft damage etc.
HIV transmission, ringworm etc.
subLabels.Subject: Subject
subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Definition of barbering. common hair diseases associated with barbering. risks associated with barbering and safety measures. barbering tools, materials and their maintenance
descriptions: Candidate should be able to define shampoos and conditioners and be able to select the right type of shampoos and conditioners for different textures of hair. Candidates are expected to have carried out practical activities of shampooing and conditioning.
subLabels.Subject: Subject
subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Shampoos and conditioners. reasons for hair shampooing and conditioning
descriptions: Moisturizers, cleansers, lotions, toners, creamse.t.c.
Acne, eczema, ringworm, inflammation of the skin e.t.c.
subLabels.Subject: Subject
subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Skin—definition and types of skin skin care types of skin care products and their usage
descriptions: Wrinkles, acne, pimples etc. Facial creams, nutrition, facial aerobics etc
subLabels.Subject: Subject
subLabels.subject: Cosmetology

subLabels.text: Abuse of skin care products. common skin problems and treatments
descriptions: Candidates are expected to have carried out practical activities on application of lipsticks
